body.p: This section describes the process for obtaining a copy of the RabbitMQ .Net/C# RabbitMQ client library source code, as well as instructions for building the .Net/C# client libraries from source.

ul.li: Either download a released source code distribution from the download page, or

Check the code out directly from our GitHub repositories:
git clone https://github.com/rabbitmq/rabbitmq-dotnet-client.git

doc:section.name: prerequisites
doc:section.doc:heading: Required Libraries and Tools
doc:section.p: To build the .NET/C# client libraries on Windows, you will need

ul.li: Microsoft Visual Studio® 2015 or later (optional, Community edition is fine)

doc:subsection.name: building-on-windows-with-vs
doc:subsection.doc:heading: On Windows, with Visual Studio
doc:subsection.p: To build the source with Visual Studio you need to:

ul.li: Run build.bat. This will perform the required code generation as well as building a release version of the code.

Open RabbitMQDotNetClient.sln in Visual Studio. That may fail if the version of Visual Studio used is different from the one that created the solution file. In most such cases this can be corrected by opening the solution file in a text editor and adjusting the Format Version number at the beginning.

doc:subsection.name: building-on-windows-no-vs
doc:subsection.doc:heading: On Windows, without Visual Studio
doc:subsection.p: To build the source without Visual Studio:

ul.li: Run build.bat. This will perform the required code generation as well as building a release version of the code.

doc:subsection.name: building-on-linux
doc:subsection.doc:heading: On Linux
doc:subsection.p: The library can be built on Linux with Mono, but only with Mono version 3.8 and later. You can obtain the latest versions of Mono at mono-project.com
Once you have installed a suitable version of Mono, and obtained the RabbitMQ .Net/C# RabbitMQ client library source code, to build the library you should:

ul.li: Run build.sh. This will perform the required code generation as well as building a release version of the code.
